Aeromarine Airways, Inc.
(Established 1920)
Times Building - New York City
" BE SURE IT'S AN AROMARINE"
MYTHOLOGY teaches us that
since the beginning of time
the youth of all nations and races
has dreamed of flying, but only
during the past few years has this
been possible.
Some day, much sooner than most
people realize, the person who has
not flown will be difficult to find.
Aerial Transportation is rapidly
growing in popularity, especially
where Alying boats are used be-
cause they are as much in their
element on the water as in the air,
thus always affording a safe land-
ing place.
The thousands of passengers car-
ried in AEROMARINE Aying
boats include people of promi-
nence from all over the world.
For the benefit of those who have
not yet enjoyed the lure and charm
of a safe, smooth glide through the
air, we reproduce herewith a few
letters, believing their expressions
regarding this
latest and most
exhilarating mode of travel will
prove interesting.
Copyright Aeromarine Airways, Inc., 1922

Abr11 15th, 1922.
Dear
Sir,
I am extremely pleased to have the opportunity
of expressing to you the pleasure that I had in crossing
from the United States to Cuba. The trip was extremely
comfortable,
quick and, at the same time, the feeling of
safety was very great.
As pioneers in flying, you ought to be better
known and I wish you every kind of good luck in your
enterprise.
Yours very truly,
Mitre
Roumanian Minister.
Hundreds of other prominent people,
who have
flown in Aeromarine Flying Boats, are equally en-
thusiastic over the experience.
